alert.note: Alert for Clay; Knox; Laurel; McCreary; Pulaski; Wayne; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 22 at 12:15PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Wayne, Laurel, northwestern Knox, southeastern Pulaski, McCreary, northwestern Whitley and west central Clay Counties through 1245 PM EST... At 1214 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Billows to near Greenwood to near Sunnybrook. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Wood Creek Lake, Bernstadt, Honeybee, Cumberland Falls S.P., Greenwood, Bunch, Parkers Lake and Mount Victory around 1220 PM EST. London, East Bernstadt, Hare, Carmichael, Bark Camp, Huxley, Pittsburg, Baldrock, Youngs Creek and Rockcastle Springs around 1225 PM EST. Grove, Rye, Vox, Holly Bay Rec. Area, Griffin, Deering, Rockeybranch, Maplesville, Walden and Coopersville around 1230 PM EST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Barton, Co- Operative, North Corbin, Dorthae, Crawford, Keavy, Woodbine, Langnau, Faber, Portersburg, Blue Heron, Fogertown, Moore Hill, Gray, Lily, Grace, Wilton, Byron, Fariston, Urban, Manchester, Whitley City, Pine Knot, Stearns, Lynn Camp, Knoxfork, Tuttle, McHargue, Fall Rock and Marshes Siding. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Knox; Laurel; McCreary; Pulaski; Wayne; Whitley
